definitions.definition: A measure of the asymmetry of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable; is the third standardized moment , defined as γ 1 = μ 3 σ 3 , {\displaystyle \scriptstyle \gamma _{1}={\frac {\mu _{3}}{\sigma ^{3}}},\!} where μ 3 {\displaystyle \mu _{3}} is the third moment about the mean and σ {\displaystyle \sigma } is the standard deviation .

secondary_definitions: ( statistics ) A measure of the asymmetry of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable; is the third standardized moment , defined as γ 1 = μ 3 σ 3 , {\displaystyle \scriptstyle \gamma _{1}={\frac {\mu _{3}}{\sigma ^{3}}},\!} where μ 3 {\displaystyle \mu _{3}} is the third moment about the mean and σ {\displaystyle \sigma } is the standard deviation .
